<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Bonded Animal](/Feats.aspx?ID=762) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Downtime" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=49" />
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 259 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
Expert in [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)

</column>

---

You forge strong connections with animals. You can spend 7 days of downtime regularly interacting with a normal animal (not a companion or other special animal) that is friendly or helpful to you. After this duration, attempt a DC 20 [Nature](/Domains.aspx?ID=22) check. If successful, you bond with the animal. The animal is permanently [helpful](/Conditions.aspx?ID=21) to you, unless you do something egregious to break your bond. A helpful animal is easier to direct, as described under [Command an Animal](/Actions.aspx?ID=58).

 Bonding with a new animal ends any previous bond you had. You can't have both a bonded animal and an animal companion (though you can have both a bonded animal and a familiar).
name: Bonded Animal
